# Situation 1
In this simulation, the correlation between ${x}$ and ${y}$ is induced by two orthogonal directions.
```{r,warning=FALSE,message=FALSE}
library(scca)

#situation 1
GenStrucData_Normal=function(u,v,n=50,sigma_z=1,sigma_x=NULL,sigma_y=NULL){
  p=length(u)
  q=length(v)
  if(is.null(sigma_x)){sigma_x=diag(1,p,p)}
  if(is.null(sigma_y)){sigma_y=diag(1,q,q)}
  x=c()
  y=c()
  u1=u;v1=v
  u2=0.5*(-u1);v2=0.5*(-v1)
  for(i in 1:n){
    zi1=rnorm(1,0,sigma_z)
    zi2=rnorm(1,0,sigma_z)
    xi=zi1*u1+zi2*u2+mvrnorm(1,rep(0,p),sigma_x)
    x=rbind(x,xi)
    yi=zi1*v1+zi2*v2+mvrnorm(1,rep(0,q),sigma_y)
    y=rbind(y,yi)
  }
  #print (sigma_x, sigma_y, sigma_z)
  return(list(x=x,y=y))
}

sigma_x = arcov(0.7,100)
sigma_y=sigma_x

edges=c(as.numeric(combn(1:10,2)),as.numeric(combn(11:20,2)),21:100)

u=c(rep(1,10),rep(-1,10),rep(0,80))
v=u
model4S0s1=finals(s0cca_simu(10,u,v,50,'normal',1,sigma_x,sigma_y))
model4S1s1=finals(s1cca_simu(10,u,v,50,'normal',1,sigma_x,sigma_y))
model4elnets1=finals(elnet.cca.simu(10,u,v,50,'normal',1,sigma_x,sigma_y))
model4gsccas1=finals(gscca.simu.normal(10,edges,u,v,50,'normal',1,sigma_x,sigma_y))
```
